text.value: In paintings of the past, according to the art historian John Berger, “men act; women appear”. Looking at the evidence from this painting, which of the following statements do you consider to be most persuasive about the way in which Jane, Henry’s third wife, is presented?

value.value: She is his partner but clearly beneath him in rank
She is presented as his regal partner, equal to Henry in rank
She is presented as little more than a servant
She is presented as an idealised woman, above Henry in rank
